Description: Rim sherd of Chian pottery Type B kantharos; white slip; interior: reserved band at rim, glazed (fired red and very worn) below; exterior reserved; inscription on exterior.
Curator's comments: The sherd probably belongs to the same vase as British Museum 1924,1201.756. Many kantharoi Type B have painted inscriptions beneath the rim and several have been found on Aegina as well as at Naukratis (Williams 1983, 169). Williams, D. ‘Aigina, Aphaia-Tempel 5. The pottery from Chios’, Archäologischer Anzeiger 1983
Bibliographic references: Cook & Woodhead 1952 / Painted Inscriptions on Chiot Pottery (p.168, no. 133)
Bernand 1970 / Le Delta égyptien d'après les textes grecs, i: les confins libyques (p. 726, no. 858)
Villing et al 2013-2015 / Naukratis: Greeks in Egypt (GD.1837) (phase 2)
